programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Meet Martha's chickens! Now with over 200 chickens and 20 different breeds, Martha shares her vast knowledge about raising and caring for her flock. Then learn the how-tos of building the a coop.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.sub-title: Martha Builds a Raised Bed Vegetable Garden
programme.desc: Martha builds a brand new, half-acre raised bed vegetable garden on her farm! It's a step-by-step guide to designing, building, preparing the soil, and planting.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Everything is coming up roses on Martha's Bedford farm; join Martha while she creates new garden with almost 200 roses.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.sub-title: Martha's Amazing Maze and How to Grow Trees From Seedlings
programme.desc: Welcome to Martha's passion project: the maze on her Bedford farm. Learn how to properly plant trees including measuring, fertilizing, and watering. Plus, how to start trees from seedlings.

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shows how to make bakery-style cookies using better-for-you ingredients: farro chocolate-chunk, spelt-nut crescents, whole-wheat almond-butter sandwich, and granola

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha creates naturally gluten-free desserts: lemon-cornmeal cake, spiced pumpkin pie with crisp rice crust, and decadent flourless chocolate-walnut torte

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha transforms bread recipes using alternative flours: honey-wheat Parker House rolls, whole-wheat pita, and tasty molasses-oat bread. Plus, tips for making honey butter

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha updates vintage cake recipes with healthful ingredients: oat roulade with berry cream, chocolate buckwheat torte, and zucchini-almond cake with cream cheese frosting

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Pan-searing means browning food over high heat to develop a crust and lock in juiciness. Martha prepares scallops, salmon fillets, steak with mustard cream sauce, duck breasts

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: A beautifully cooked roast makes a grand centerpiece for any dinner. Martha shares techniques for prime rib roast, crown roast of pork, and stuffed turkey breast

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Hearty stews are made with inexpensive cuts of meat and require little hands-on prep time. Martha demonstrates three classic recipes: beef stew, coq au vin, and veal stew

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shares her favorite recipes based on a simple and delicious yellow cake, including her father's birthday cake, stone fruit upside-down cake, and strawberry cupcakes

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Watch Martha demonstrate three delightfully rich pound cake recipes, from traditional to one inspired by her travels through Asia, using butter, cream cheese, and semolina

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha makes puff pastry approachable for any home cook. She creates a variety of savory and sweet goodies using puff pastry including the iconic French pastry, the Napoleon

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha presents three light and airy brioche bread variations: brioche a tete, brioche loaf, and baba au Rhum. Plus, Martha's French toast

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha bakes her favorite cookies: brown sugar chocolate chip, old-fashioned lemon-sugar, sables, chewy chocolate ginger-molasses, and glazed citrus doodles

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha teaches you how to make pizza at home, including an easy gluten-free dough: heirloom tomato pizza, grape focaccia, tarte flambee, and three-cheese gluten-free calzone

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shares her expertise on how to make three celebration cakes: genoise with passion fruit buttercream, orange-almond wedding cake with buttercream, and chocolate-rum roulade

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shares her secrets for making four simple and delicious tarts: apple tart tatin, chewy chess tart, lemon meringue tartlets, and mini rhubarb and raspberry galettes

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.sub-title: Japanese Cuisine: Sushi, Sashimi and More
programme.desc: Martha visits the Japanese restaurant Joji in the heart of New York, where Chef George Ruan shares his secrets for the ultimate omakase experience; culinary giant Daniel Boulud stops by.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha starts off brunch with a citrus cocktail Mary's knees; Chef Ignacio Mattos joins and makes an omelette with caviar and creme fraiche; Martha makes an endive salad; Martha makes waffles.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.sub-title: How to Make Croissants and Sourdough Bread
programme.desc: Martha journeys through her local area in search of the ultimate fresh-baked croissants and sourdough bread; learning about homemade bread and pastries.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.sub-title: One Pot Wonders With Jamie Oliver
programme.desc: Martha is in the test kitchen with English chef, restaurateur, and author Jamie Oliver, and they're cooking up a mouth-watering menu of dishes that are easy to make.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha and her niece Sophie visit their favorite tea shop, Arogya, in Westport, Conn., to discover the do's and don'ts of making tea; they return to Martha's kitchen to create dishes with tea.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha visits Mast Market in Mt. Kisco, N.Y., and learns the art behind making their renowned chocolate; from roasting cacao, to stone grinding, to forming delicious bars and chips.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.sub-title: Inside Martha's Vegetable Greenhouse; Seed Starting
programme.desc: Martha takes us inside her vegetable greenhouse to see how she has turned her harvest into a year-round bounty. Then, how she collects, stores, and sows seeds. Plus Martha makes her perfect green drink.

programme.desc: Martha visits the incredible Orchid Show at the New York Botanical Garden. This year's show immerses you in a mesmerizing array of orchids designed by acclaimed artist Lily Kwong.
